constituent: give up, say, words, keitai, mouth, sovereign, vase, stand up, apron, crown, towel
heisigStory: The key word renunciation has to do with the wisdom and clarity of mind in knowing when to "let go." This is what makes the words of acquiescense sovern.
koohiiStory1: The words of the sovereign king inspire the people: never give up! Never surrender! Okay...maybe it wasn´t a king.
koohiiStory2: Anytime I think to give up Japanese, I remember giving my word that I would become sovereign of Japanese! And I watch あきら to get pumped about it. Note: to give up - 諦める is read あきらめる).
kunYomi: あき.らめる、あきら.める、つまびらか、まこと
myStory: chữ Đế. sự thật. từ bỏ. xem xét kỹ. những lời nói của hoàng gia là sự thật cần từ bỏ. ngôn + đế.
words:
諦め(あきらめ): resignation, acceptance, consolation
諦める(あきらめる): give up, abandon
